ARABIC: أَءُلْقِىَ ٱلذِّكْرُ عَلَيْهِ مِنۢ بَيْنِنَا بَلْ هُوَ كَذَّابٌ أَشِرٌ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Has the Reminder been given to him of all of us? No indeed! He is an impudent liar.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Was he the one of all of us to have been given the exposition? He is surely an impudent liar."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Was there none but he to whom the Reminder could be vouchsafed excluding all others? Nay; he is an insolent liar.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: How is it that he has received guidance? In fact, he is the most untruthfull and arrogant person".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “What! Of all the men among us, the remembrance has come down upon him? In fact, he is a mischievous, great liar.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Is it that the Reminder is sent to him alone from among us Nay, he is an insolent liar!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Has the reminder been made to light upon him from among us? Nay! he is an insolent liar!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Has the Reminder been cast upon him alone among us? Nay, rather he is an impudent liar.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Hath the remembrance been given unto him alone among us? Nay, but he is a rash liar.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Has the [Divine] message been revealed to him alone of all of us? No, he is a boastful liar."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Hath the Admonition been laid upon him from amongst us! Aye! he is a liar insolent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: ‘Has the Reminder been cast upon him from among us? No, he is a self-conceited liar.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Is it that the Message is sent to him, of all people amongst us? Nay, he is a liar, an insolent one!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Is it that the Reminder is sent to him [Prophet Salih (Saleh)] alone from among us? Nay, he is an insolent liar!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Out of all of us has the Reminder been given to him alone? Rather, he is indeed an arrogant liar'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Was the message given to him, out of all of us? In fact, he is a wicked liar.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Has the message been sent down upon him from among us? Rather, he is an insolent liar."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [54:25] Has the Reminder, the revelation, been cast (read a-ulqiya pronouncing both hamzas, or by not pronouncing the second one but in both cases inserting an intervening alif, or leaving this [insertion] out) upon him [alone] from among us?, in other words, nothing has been revealed to him. Nay, but he is a conceited, an arrogant and insolent, liar, in his saying that the mentioned has been revealed to him. God, exalted be He, says:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Hath the remembrance) prophethood (been given unto him alone among us) when we are nobler than him? (Nay, but he is a rash liar) Salih is a vain liar who lies against Allah.
